p.seg: State of Nebraska Department of Trade and Commerce Bureau of Insurance Summary of Insurance Business in Nebraska for the year 1923 Also Comparative Figures of Authorized Companies for the Years 1920, 1921 and 1922 CHARLES W. BRYAN, Governor K. C. KNUDSON, MRS. M. A. FAIRCHILD, MRS. M. A. FAIRCHILD, Deputy Secretary of Trade and Assistant Chief of Bureau of Commerce Insurance
Kline Publishing Company

To His Excellency: Hon. Charles W. Bryan, Governor. We herewith submit the summary of business of companies authorized to write insurance in this State for the year ending December 31. 1923. including the names of companies organized, admitted, reinsured, with - drawn, examined, etc., during the year. DEPARTMENT OF TRADE AND COMMERCE. K. C. KNUDSON, Deputy Secretary. MRS. M. A. PAIRCHILD, Assistant Chief of the Bureau of Insurance.

4 NEBRASKA INSURANCE REPORT COMPANIES ORGANIZED IN NEBRASKA IN 1923 1. Business Men's Protective Association, Liu. -oln. Nebraska. Organized on assessment plan, writes accident anil health. 2. Service Life Insurance Company, Lincoln, Nebraska. Stock Legal Reserve, writes life insurance. COMPANIES OF OTHER STATES ADMITTED IN 1923. 1. AttiliateU Underwriters, New York. Reciprocal exchange, Writing fire insuiance. 2. Allemannia Fire, Pittsburgh, Pa. Writing lire insurance. u. Banker National Life, Denver, Colorado, Legal Reserve Life In surance Company. 4. Casualty Indemnity Exchange. St. Louis, writes druggists liability Insurance. 5. Eagle Fire of New Yo- k, writes fire anJ marine insurance. fi. Eagle Indemnity of New York, writes health, accident, liability, fidelity, surety, burglary, the.i, forgery, glass, steam boiler, auto - mobile and air craft. 7. East and West Insurance Co. of New Haven. Connecticut. Writes fire insurance. 8. Fort Dearborn Casualty Underwriter of Chicago. Writes automo - bile and plate glass on reciprocal plan. 9. General Indemnity, corporation, Rochester, New York. Writes burglary, theft and forgery. 10. Great Northern Insurance, Wausa, Wisconsin. Writes life and ac - cident insurance. 11. Importers and Exporters Insurance Company, New York. Writes fire and marine. 12. Independence Indemnity, Philadelphia. Pa. Writes all casualty lines, except workmen's compensation. 13. Lincoln Casualty, Springfield. Illinois. Writes accident, health, burglary, theft, automobile. 14. Lutheran Brotherhood, Minneapolis. Minn. A fraternal beneficiary society. 15. Lutheran Mutual Aid Society. Waverly, Iowa. A fraternal bene ficiary society. 16. Medical Protective Company. Fort Wayne, Indiana. Writes physicans liability. 17. Michigan Automobile Insurance Company, Grand Rapids. Michigan Writes automobile insurance. 18. Mountain State Life, Denver, Colorado. Writes life, health and accident. 19. National Benefit Life. Washington, D. C. Writes life insurance. 20. National Fidelity Life, Kansas City, Missouri. Writes life insurance. 21. National Retail Lumber dealers Intei -insurance exchange, Detroit. Michigan. 22. New York Indemnity Company. New York. Writes all lines oi casualty insurance except workmen's compensation 23. Ohio Millers Mutual Fire. Canton. Ohio. Writes fire insurance. 24. .Philadelphia Fire and Marine Insurance Company, Philadelphia Pa. Writes fire and lightning. 25. Producers and Refirers Underwriters. Kansas City, Mo. Writes fire Insurance. 26. Retail Lumberman's Inter-Insuranre Exchange Minneapolis, Minn Writes fire and lightning 27. State Automobile Insurance Association, Des Moines. Iowa. Write* automobile insurance on the reciprocal plan. 28. Sun Indemnity Company, New York. Writes all casualty lines. 29. Union Assurance Society, Chicago, Illinois. Writes fire insurance 50. Universal Underwriter, Kansas City, Missouri. Writes fire anc lightning on the reciprocal plam.

NEBRASKA INSURANCE REPORT 5 COMPANIES THAT RE INSURED, CHANGED NAME, WITHDREW. ETC., IN 1923. 1. American Bankers Insurance Company, Chicago, Hllinols, withdrew May 1. 1923. 2. Bankers Inter-insurance Alliance, Kansas City, Mo., withdrew May 1, 1923. 3. Benefit Association of Railway Employees, changed to Legal Re - serve writing accident and health insurance. Formerly a fraternal. 4. Central Business Men Assocation reinsured in Great Northern Life of Chicago, Illinois, February 22. 1923. 5. Cleveland National Fire, Cleveland, Ohio, withdrew May 1, 1923. 6. Commonwealth Life, Omaha, Nebraska Merged with Standard Life of Decatur. Illinois, December 21, 1923. 7. Des Moines Reinsurance Fire, Des Moines, Iowa, withdrew May 1. 1923. 8. Eureka Insurance Company, Philadelphia, Pa., withdrew May 1. 1923. 9. Fa-mers Mutual Assessment Association, Sutherland, Nebraska. Dissolved in 1922. 10. Fidelity Reserve Company. North Platte, Nebraska . Reinsured in Mountain States Life of Denver. Colorado, November 10, 1923. 11. Great Republic Fire. Des Moines, Iowa, withdrew May 1, 1923. 12. Illinois Automobile Insurance Exchange, Chicago, Illinois, withdrew May 1. 1923. 13. Ioup Valley Mutual, Ord, Nebraska. Reinsured in Farm Central Mutual of Hastings. February 15, 1923. 14. Michigan Automobile Insurance Company, reinsured in Central West Casualty of Detroit. Michigan. December 31. 1923 15. Mutual Protective Fire of Seward, Nebraska. Changed name to Protective Fire Insurance Company. 16. National Fidelity Life, Sioux City, Iowa. Reinsured in National Fidelity Life, Kansas City, Mo.. April 18. 1923. 17. National Travelers Benef't. Des Moines. Iowa. Changed to National Travelers Casualty Association. 18. North American Life. Omaha. Nebraska. Changed name to North American National Life. 19. Salamandra Insurance Company, Petrograd, Russia, withdrew May 1, 1923. COMPANIES EXAMINED DURING THE YEAR 1923. Nebraska Companies.
